Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • Game
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class Game
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    This is the JFrame that pulls everything together. It will contain a model of the board that will be used to analyze the game's state and outcome. It will also hold the logic to determine the winner of each game. This is where the main method will reside.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • streak

        private boolean streak(int one,
                       int two,
                       int three)
        This evaluates whether or not three specified values are owned by the same player.
        Parameters:
        one - the first value
        two - the second value
        three - the third value
        Returns:
        true if it is 3 in a row, and passes the winner to gameOver

      • gameOver

        private boolean gameOver(int player)
        Ends the game in reference to Game, calls the board's endGame method Changes the text in the score panel to reflect game results
        Parameters:
        player - 0 for tie, 1 for X, and 2 for O
        Returns:
        true

      • changeScoreText

        private void changeScoreText()
        Changes the text from "player X's turn" to "Player O's turn" and vice versa

      • isBoardFilled

        boolean isBoardFilled()
        Determines whether or not the board is entirely filled
        Returns:
        true if there are no more empty spots

      • isGameOver

        boolean isGameOver()
        Checks to see if the game is over
        Returns:
        true if there is either a winner or the board is full

      • turn

        void turn(int player,
          int row,
          int col)
        This triggers the actions that take place whenever a player takes their turn
        Parameters:
        player - The number of the player who's turn it is (1:X, 2:O)
        row - The row of the button that was pressed
        col - The col of the button that was pressed
